column2: NM DMV PRACTICE TEST
column4: New Mexico

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. A pedestrian starts to cross in front of your vehicle. You should:
column4: sound your horn and proceed with caution.
column6: speed up and pass in front of the pedestrian.
column8: slow down.
column10: stop until the person is out of the crosswalk.

column2: 2. If you stop along the road at night:
column4: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.
column8: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: Lane reduction ahead
column6: You must come to a complete stop and yield right-of-way
column8: Slow down and yield to traffic on main road when merging
column10: Always come to a complete stop

column2: 4. There are two traffic lanes in your direction. You are driving in the left lane and many vehicles are passing you on the right, and the driver behind you wishes to drive faster. You should:
column4: move over into the right lane when safe to do so.
column6: stay in your lane and maintain your current speed.
column8: drive onto the left shoulder to let the other driver pass.

column2: 5. To be able to turn quickly, your hands should be:
column4: next to each other on the top of the steering wheel.
column6: on the steering wheel, so they are at the 6 and 12 o'clock positions.
column8: placed outside of the steering wheel on opposite sides

column2: 6. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column6: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column8: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.
column10: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.

column2: 7. The sign in the picture:
column4: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column8: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column10: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.

column2: 8. Continuous hard braking on ice and snow often:
column4: is the best option during winter.
column8: causes the front wheels to lock.

column2: 9. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: cut abruptly in front of it.
column6: pull in front of the large vehicle before you can see the whole front of the vehicle in your mirror.
column8: delay near it.
column10: pay close attention to the turn signals.

column2: 10. The use of alcohol and/or drugs affects:
column4: concentration and reaction time.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 11. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column4: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column8: respect the posted speed limit.

column2: 12. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Do not drive if you are very weary.
column6: Keep your vehicle in good condition.
column8: Maintain the correct speed.

column2: 13. To avoid hydroplaning, drivers should:
column4: drive at a constant speed.
column8: slow down.

column2: 14. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
column4: that a divided highway ends
column8: that a reversible lane starts.

column2: 15. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
column4: green, yellow and red.
column8: red, yellow and green.

column2: 16. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: to signal all lane changes.
column6: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.
column8: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.

column2: 17. This sign tells drivers:
column4: turning right on red is forbidden.
column6: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.
column8: they may not turn right or left during the red light.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column4: You may proceed at regular speed through the intersection
column8: You must come to a complete stop
column10: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary

column2: 19. When riding in a vehicle equipped with air bags is, children ages 12 and under are safer:
column4: buckled up in the front seat.
column6: in the bed of a pick-up truck.
column8: buckled up in the back seat.

column2: 20. When passing other vehicles, drivers should:
column4: apply the brake and slow down.
column6: pass the vehicle as slowly as possible.
column8: make sure the passing lane is clear of traffic, and check behind and to the left to make sure another vehicle is not attempting to pass.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column4: Side road
column8: Stop sign ahead
column10: Keep to the side indicated by the arrow

column2: 22. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a cross road.
column8: a winding road.

column2: 23. When following another vehicle at night, drivers should use:
column4: low beam headlights.
column8: emergency flashers.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: Wrong Way
column8: Curve ahead

column2: 25. Before passing a vehicle or changing lanes, remember to:
column4: only pass or change lanes if the change can be completed  without speeding.
column6: sound your horn as you pass.
column8: signal your return to the left lane.
